summary: MHT-CET mock test platform called 'Concept Delta' with two test types: Full Syllabus Mock Tests (2 sections: 90min Physics+Chemistry, 90min Maths) and Chapter-Wise Tests (admin-configurable single section with custom duration, marks per question, and mixed subject support). Built on Internet Computer with Motoko backend and React frontend, featuring Internet Identity auth, admin panel for question/test management, student dashboard, timed test interface, scoring, leaderboards, PDF export, and YouTube subscription gate.
architectural_notes: Motoko backend canister with stable memory for persistence
React frontend canister with Vite, React Router, React Query, Tailwind CSS
Navy blue (#1e3a8a) primary color with white background, Inter font
Base64 image storage in backend (consider asset canister if 1000+ questions)
Scoring: Physics/Chemistry 1 mark each, Maths 2 marks each, no negative marking
Mobile-first responsive design: <640px mobile, 640-1024px tablet, >1024px desktop
Test types: 'fullSyllabus' (auto-split, 90+90 min, fixed marking) or 'chapterWise' (admin-configurable duration, marks, single section)
Logo: Delta (Δ) symbol, brand name 'Concept Delta' not 'COEPian Delta'
Question model: optional text/image for question, 4 options each with optional text/image, correctAnswer index 0-3, explanation, subject (Physics/Chemistry/Maths), class (11th/12th)
known_issues: Base64 image storage may cause large canister memory usage with 1000+ questions
YouTube subscription verification requires manual admin check (honor system initially)
Mobile responsiveness critical as 70%+ students use phones
Admin users receiving 'Unauthorized: Only admins can create questions' error even when they have admin role
Admin users not seeing Admin panel option in menu bar even with admin role assigned
Admin registration popup showing 'actor is not available' error preventing role assignment
Admin Setup navigation link not appearing in Navbar despite deployment
Admin Setup navigation link not visible in Navbar despite user requesting it to be added back after removal
First admin registration blocked by authorization check running before empty-list check (bootstrapping issue)

existing_features.title: Change all references from 'COEPian Delta' to 'Concept Delta' throughout the application (navbar, footer, PDF exports, branding elements)

Replace the Telegram section image at XPath /html[1]/body[1]/div[1]/div[1]/main[1]/div[1]/div[2]/section[3]/div[1]/div[1]/div[1]/img[1] with a generated notes/notebook image

Integrate the generated teacher-teaching-student and notes images as static assets in frontend/public/assets/generated and reference them in the YouTube and Telegram sections respectively

Create an admin question creation page component in frontend/src/pages/AdminQuestionCreate.tsx with form fields for question text (textarea, optional), question image upload (file input accepting images, optional), four option sections each with text input and image upload (all optional), a radio button group to select the correct answer (0-3), explanation textarea, subject dropdown (Physics/Chemistry/Maths), and class level dropdown (11th/12th)

Integrate the admin question creation form with the backend createQuestion API using React Query mutation, handle form submission by converting uploaded images to base64, validate that at least one of question text or question image is provided and at least one option has content, display success message with the created question ID on successful creation, and show error messages for validation or API failures
Add a route for the admin question creation page in frontend/src/routeTree.tsx at path '/admin/questions/create', accessible only when user is authenticated with admin role
Add a 'Create Question' button or navigation link in the AdminDashboard.tsx component that navigates to the question creation page at /admin/questions/create

Create a React Query mutation hook useFullSyllabusTestMutations in a new file frontend/src/hooks/useFullSyllabusTestMutations.ts that provides functions to create a new Full Syllabus Test (createFullSyllabusTest) and assign questions to a test (assignQuestionsToTest), with query invalidation on success

Create an admin Full Syllabus Test creation page component in frontend/src/pages/AdminFullSyllabusTestCreate.tsx with a form containing test name input field, two question selection sections (Section 1 for Physics+Chemistry, Section 2 for Maths), where each section displays available questions filtered by subject with checkboxes for selection, and a submit button that creates the test and assigns selected questions

Update the AdminDashboard.tsx Test Management tab to display both full syllabus tests and chapter-wise tests in separate lists, showing for each test type: test name, test type label ('Full Syllabus' or 'Chapter-Wise'), configuration summary (for fullSyllabus: '2 sections, 90+90min'; for chapterWise: 'duration in minutes, marks per question'), number of assigned questions, and creation date

Update AdminDashboard.tsx Test Management tab to group and display chapter-wise tests by class level (11th and 12th) in separate sections, with each class level section containing subject-based subsections (Physics, Chemistry, Mathematics) showing tests filtered by their assigned questions' subjects

Create a React Query hook useChapterWiseTestById in frontend/src/hooks/useQueries.ts that fetches a single chapter-wise test by ID with its complete assigned question details including subject and class level properties
Create a React Query hook useLeaderboard in frontend/src/hooks/useQueries.ts that fetches leaderboard data for a given testId using the getLeaderboard backend endpoint

Update the Leaderboard.tsx page component to fetch and display the top 10 scorers using the useLeaderboard hook with testId from URL parameters, showing a table or card layout with columns for rank (1-10), user name, total score with unit label (e.g., '85 marks'), and time taken in MM:SS format
Add a 'Back to Dashboard' button in Leaderboard.tsx that navigates to the StudentDashboard when clicked

Add visual ranking indicators in Leaderboard.tsx for the top 3 positions: display a gold medal icon or gold background for rank 1, silver medal/background for rank 2, and bronze medal/background for rank 3, with standard styling for ranks 4-10

Create a utility module in frontend/src/utils/pdfExport.ts that provides a function generateResultPDF accepting test attempt data, test details, user profile, and question details, and generates a formatted PDF document with Concept Delta branding

Design the PDF layout to include a header section with the Concept Delta logo, test name, student name from user profile, attempt date formatted as readable date string, and overall score prominently displayed

Include a score summary section in the PDF showing total score with unit label (e.g., '85/200 marks'), percentage score, section-wise breakdown for full syllabus tests (Section 1 score, Section 2 score), total time taken formatted as HH:MM:SS, and performance indicator based on percentage (e.g., 'Excellent' for 80%+, 'Good' for 60-79%, 'Needs Improvement' for below 60%)

Add a question-by-question breakdown section in the PDF that lists all questions with their question number, question text (truncated if too long), the user's selected answer option text, correct answer option text, whether the answer was correct or incorrect with visual indicator (✓ or ✗), and marks awarded for that question

Add a footer to each PDF page with the Concept Delta branding text, website URL or social media handle @coep_conceptdelta2031, and page numbers in 'Page X of Y' format

Update ResultPage.tsx and TestInterface.tsx to handle questions with null/missing explanations gracefully by hiding the explanation section or displaying a placeholder message when no explanation exists

Update the PDF export utility in frontend/src/utils/pdfExport.ts to handle questions with null/missing explanations by omitting the explanation row in the question breakdown section when no explanation is provided
Verify that the admin token initialization in useActor.ts is correctly setting up admin credentials that can be validated by the backend authorization logic

Fix the admin authorization logic in the AdminQuestionCreate.tsx component to correctly verify admin role by checking the userRole from the useUserRole hook, ensuring that users with 'admin' role can access the question creation page without receiving 'Access Denied' error showing 'Role: user' when they should have admin permissions
Update the Navbar.tsx component to add a 'Home' navigation link that routes to the landing page ('/') and is visible to all users (authenticated and unauthenticated) in the main navigation menu

Update the Navbar.tsx component to conditionally render the 'Admin' navigation link only when the authenticated user has admin role, hiding it from users with student or no role by checking the userRole from useUserRole hook

Update all admin-related route components (AdminDashboard.tsx, AdminQuestionCreate.tsx, AdminFullSyllabusTestCreate.tsx, AdminChapterWiseTestCreate.tsx) to fetch the user role using useUserRole hook on component mount and redirect to the landing page ('/') or show an 'Access Denied' message if the user does not have admin role

Update the Navbar.tsx component to ensure the 'Admin' navigation link renders correctly for authenticated users with admin role by verifying the useGetCallerUserRole hook is properly invoked and its return value is correctly checked against 'admin' string, fixing any conditional rendering logic that may be preventing the Admin link from displaying

Debug and fix the useGetCallerUserRole hook in frontend/src/hooks/useQueries.ts to ensure it correctly fetches and returns the user role from the backend getUserRole endpoint, handling the response properly and returning 'admin' for admin users, 'student' for students, or null/undefined for unauthenticated users

Add comprehensive console logging to the Navbar.tsx component that logs the authentication state from useInternetIdentity, the user role value from useGetCallerUserRole, and the conditional rendering decision for the Admin link to help diagnose why the Admin link is not appearing for admin users

Debug and fix the useGetCallerUserRole hook in frontend/src/hooks/useQueries.ts to ensure it correctly handles the backend getUserRole endpoint response, properly parsing the returned variant type (e.g., { admin: null } or { student: null }) and returning the string 'admin' for admin users, 'student' for students, or null for unauthenticated users

Update the Navbar.tsx component to correctly check the userRole value from useGetCallerUserRole hook against the string 'admin' (not the enum variant object) to determine Admin link visibility, ensuring the conditional rendering logic compares userRole === 'admin' to display the Admin navigation link

Add enhanced diagnostic console logging to the Navbar.tsx component that logs the isAuthenticated state, the raw userRole value returned from useGetCallerUserRole (including its type), the conditional check result for admin link visibility, and timestamps for each log to help identify the exact point where the admin link rendering fails

Add comprehensive diagnostic logging throughout the admin role verification flow in both frontend and backend: log the caller's Internet Identity principal in backend/main.mo getUserRole endpoint, log the admin principals list being checked against, log the exact comparison result, and add timestamps to all logs to trace the complete authentication and authorization flow

Verify that the useGetCallerUserRole hook in frontend/src/hooks/useQueries.ts correctly parses the backend getUserRole response variant ({ #admin } or { #student }) and extracts the role name as a string ('admin' or 'student'), ensuring the hook returns the string value that Navbar.tsx expects for the userRole === 'admin' comparison

Add a temporary admin role verification bypass or fallback mechanism in the Navbar.tsx component that checks multiple sources for admin status: the useGetCallerUserRole hook result, a direct backend actor call to getUserRole, and logs all intermediate values to help identify where the admin verification chain is breaking

Update the useGetCallerUserRole hook in frontend/src/hooks/useQueries.ts to correctly parse the UserRole variant returned from the backend getUserRole endpoint (which returns { #admin } or { #student }), extract the variant tag name as a string ('admin' or 'student'), add comprehensive console logging that shows the raw response, the parsing steps, and the final string value, and return 'admin' for admin users, 'student' for students, or null for unauthenticated users

Update the Navbar.tsx component to verify that the Admin link visibility logic correctly uses the string value 'admin' from useGetCallerUserRole hook for comparison (userRole === 'admin'), add comprehensive diagnostic console logging that displays isAuthenticated state, the raw userRole value with its JavaScript type, the boolean result of the admin check comparison, and timestamps for all logs to trace the complete rendering decision flow

Add a direct backend actor query call in Navbar.tsx component that independently invokes getUserRole using the actor from useActor hook when the component mounts and when authentication state changes, logs the raw response from this direct call, compares it with the useGetCallerUserRole hook result, and displays both values in the console to identify any discrepancies in the role verification chain

Create a React Query mutation hook useAdminRegistration in a new file frontend/src/hooks/useAdminRegistration.ts that provides a registerAdmin function accepting an Internet Identity principal string, calls the backend registerAdmin endpoint, handles success and error responses, and invalidates the user role query on success

Create an admin registration page component in frontend/src/pages/AdminRegistration.tsx with a form containing an Internet Identity principal input field (text input with validation), a 'Register as Admin' submit button, instructions explaining this is for initial admin setup or adding new admins by existing admins, and success/error message display areas

Add a route for the admin registration page in frontend/src/routeTree.tsx at path '/admin/register', accessible to all authenticated users (no role restriction), allowing anyone to attempt the initial admin registration or existing admins to add new admins

Add a navigation link in Navbar.tsx labeled 'Admin Setup' or 'Register Admin' that navigates to '/admin/register' and is visible only to authenticated users who do not yet have admin role, helping new users discover the admin registration endpoint

Add a helper component or section in AdminRegistration.tsx that displays the current user's Internet Identity principal automatically when the page loads, allowing users to easily copy their own principal for registration without needing to find it in console logs

Add an informational popup or alert banner in the AdminRegistration.tsx component that displays the message 'Only admin can assign user roles' when a user attempts to register an admin principal, explaining that admin registration requires existing admin authorization (except for the first admin setup)

Update the AdminRegistration.tsx component to display the 'Unauthorized: Only admins can assign user roles' error message more prominently as a modal popup or alert dialog instead of just showing it in a toast notification, making it clear to users that they lack the required admin permissions

Investigate and fix the 'Actor not available' error that occurs when users attempt to register as admin through the AdminRegistration.tsx page, ensuring the backend actor connection is properly established before the registerAdmin mutation is called

Add proper actor availability checks in the useAdminRegistration hook in frontend/src/hooks/useAdminRegistration.ts to ensure the backend actor is fully initialized before attempting to call registerAdmin, displaying a loading state or disabled button state while the actor is initializing

Update the AdminRegistration.tsx component to use the isLoading state from useActor hook to check actor availability, displaying a loading message 'Connecting to backend...' and disabling the registration form until the actor connection is established

Add comprehensive error handling in the registerAdmin mutation in useAdminRegistration.ts that catches and distinguishes between different error types: actor initialization failures, network errors, and backend authorization errors, displaying specific user-friendly error messages for each case

Add retry logic in the useAdminRegistration mutation that automatically retries the registerAdmin call up to 2 times with exponential backoff (1 second, then 2 seconds) if it fails due to actor unavailability, only showing the error to the user after all retries are exhausted

Update the AdminRegistration.tsx component to handle the first admin registration success case by displaying a success message that confirms the user is now registered as the first admin, automatically invalidating and refetching the user role query to update the UI, and navigating to the admin dashboard after a short delay

Remove the 'Admin Setup' or 'Register Admin' navigation link from the Navbar.tsx component that was added to navigate to '/admin/register', eliminating this link entirely from the navigation menu for all users (authenticated and unauthenticated)

Update the Navbar.tsx component to add an 'Admin Setup' navigation link in the navigation section at XPath /html[1]/body[1]/div[1]/div[1]/nav[1]/div[1]/div[2] that routes to '/admin/register', visible only to authenticated users who do not have admin role (userRole !== 'admin'), positioned alongside existing navigation links

Verify the actor initialization in useActor.ts hook is complete before the AdminRegistration.tsx page attempts to call registerAdmin, implementing a robust actor availability check that waits for the actor to be fully initialized and connected before enabling the registration form

Update the useAdminRegistration hook in frontend/src/hooks/useAdminRegistration.ts to add pre-mutation validation that checks actor availability from useActor hook before attempting to call registerAdmin, throwing a user-friendly error if actor is not available and preventing the mutation from executing until actor is ready

Update the AdminRegistration.tsx component to use the isLoading state from useActor hook to display a 'Connecting to backend...' message and disable the entire registration form (including the principal input field and submit button) until the actor connection is fully established, preventing any user interaction during actor initialization

Remove the 'Admin Setup' navigation link from the Navbar.tsx component at XPath /html[1]/body[1]/div[1]/div[1]/nav[1]/div[1]/div[2], ensuring no 'Admin Setup' or 'Register Admin' link appears in the navigation menu for any user (authenticated or unauthenticated, admin or non-admin), completely eliminating this navigation option from the menu bar

Verify that the admin registration functionality at route '/admin/register' remains accessible through direct URL navigation even though the navigation link is removed from the menu bar, ensuring admins can still register new admins by navigating directly to the URL when needed

Investigate and fix the Admin Setup navigation link visibility issue in Navbar.tsx by verifying the conditional rendering logic that checks userRole !== 'admin' for authenticated users, ensuring the link appears in the navigation menu at XPath /html[1]/body[1]/div[1]/div[1]/nav[1]/div[1]/div[2] alongside existing navigation links like 'Home', 'Dashboard', and 'Logout'

Add comprehensive diagnostic logging to Navbar.tsx that logs the authentication state (isAuthenticated), the userRole value from useGetCallerUserRole hook, the conditional check result for Admin Setup link visibility (userRole !== 'admin'), the rendering decision, and timestamps to trace why the Admin Setup link is not appearing in the menu bar

Verify the useGetCallerUserRole hook is correctly returning string values ('admin', 'student', or null) and not variant objects, ensuring the Navbar.tsx comparison userRole !== 'admin' works properly with strict equality checks

Add a fallback rendering mechanism in Navbar.tsx that checks multiple conditions for showing the Admin Setup link: check if isAuthenticated is true AND userRole is explicitly 'student' OR userRole is null, providing an alternative path to display the link if the current logic fails

Review the Navbar.tsx component structure to ensure the Admin Setup link is being rendered in the correct DOM location within the navigation menu container, verifying it's not being accidentally hidden by CSS styles, z-index issues, or parent container overflow properties

Add a temporary debugging section in Navbar.tsx that visually displays the current authentication state, userRole value, and conditional check results directly in the UI (e.g., as a small debug panel or text overlay) to help diagnose why the Admin Setup link is not appearing without relying solely on console logs

Update the AdminRegistration.tsx component to automatically refetch the user role query using React Query invalidation after successful first admin registration, ensuring the UI updates immediately to reflect the new admin status without requiring page refresh or manual navigation

Update the AdminRegistration.tsx component to automatically refetch the user role using React Query invalidation immediately after successful first admin registration, then display a prominent success message confirming first admin status, and automatically navigate to the Admin Dashboard after a 2-second delay

Add a visual indicator in the AdminRegistration.tsx component that shows the current registration status for the displayed principal ID, checking if it's already registered as admin before allowing registration submission to prevent duplicate registration attempts

Update the AdminRegistration.tsx component to automatically refetch the user role query using React Query invalidation immediately after successful first admin registration, display a prominent success message confirming first admin status, and automatically navigate to the Admin Dashboard after a 2-second delay

new_feature_requests.summary: Internet Identity authentication with role-based routing (student/admin)
Admin question creation with text/image upload, 4 option images, correct answer, explanation, subject tag, class level
Admin test creation for chapter-wise tests: name, duration, marks per question, question selection
Student test-taking interface with timer, navigation, mark for review, auto-submit
Result page with score, time breakdown, correct/incorrect stats, question review with explanations
Full syllabus mock tests with auto-split (Section 1: 90min Physics+Chemistry 1 mark each, Section 2: 90min Maths 2 marks each)
Leaderboard showing top 10 scorers with rank, name, score, time
Admin analytics dashboard with user stats, test attempts, completion rates, daily active users
PDF export with Concept Delta branding, score summary, question breakdown
YouTube subscription gate popup before test access
Social sharing to WhatsApp/Telegram with pre-filled score message
Admin user management: view users, block/unblock, manual subscription verification
Question gallery with grid view, filters by subject/class, search, preview
Student suggestion system with form and admin review interface
Landing page with hero section, features, YouTube link, 'Get Started' CTA using provided image at top
Landing page tagline: 'Founded by COEP Technological University students' (bold) and 'One of Maharashtra's top engineering institutes' (small text at bottom)
YouTube channel section with logo, link to @conceptdelta2026, and text: 'Subscribe to YouTube channel to unlock all test series'
Telegram channel section with colorful logo, link to t.me/Conceptdelta, and text: 'Join Telegram for test explanations'
Landing page background: clean white with blurred students-studying image
Add teacher-teaching-student image near YouTube section
Add notes image near Telegram section

Question data model: text (optional), image (optional), 4 options each with text and image (optional), correct answer index (0-3), explanation, subject tag (Physics/Chemistry/Maths), class level (11th/12th)
Admin question creation interface with text and image upload fields, 4 option fields (text + image upload each), correct answer selector, explanation textarea, subject dropdown, class dropdown

Create a Motoko data model for questions in backend/main.mo with fields: questionText (optional Text), questionImage (optional Text for base64), four options each containing optionText (optional Text) and optionImage (optional Text for base64), correctAnswerIndex (Nat from 0-3), explanation (Text), subject (variant type: Physics, Chemistry, Maths), and classLevel (variant type: Class11th, Class12th)
Implement stable storage in backend/main.mo to persist questions across canister upgrades using stable variables, storing questions in a stable array or HashMap

Create a backend API endpoint createQuestion in backend/main.mo that accepts questionText (optional), questionImage (optional base64 string), four option objects (each with optionText and optionImage), correctAnswerIndex (0-3), explanation text, subject enum, and classLevel enum, validates the input, generates a unique question ID, stores the question in stable storage, and returns the question ID
Add role-based authorization to the createQuestion endpoint so only authenticated admin users can create questions, using Internet Identity principal to verify admin status

Create a Motoko data model in backend/main.mo for Full Syllabus Mock Tests with fields: testId (unique identifier), testName (Text), createdAt (timestamp), section1 configuration (duration 90 minutes, subjects Physics and Chemistry, marks per question 1), section2 configuration (duration 90 minutes, subject Maths, marks per question 2), and status (active/inactive)
Implement stable storage in backend/main.mo for Full Syllabus Mock Tests using stable variables, storing tests in a stable HashMap or array to persist across canister upgrades

Create a backend API endpoint createFullSyllabusTest in backend/main.mo that accepts testName (Text), validates input, generates a unique test ID, creates a test with pre-configured section1 (90min Physics+Chemistry, 1 mark each) and section2 (90min Maths, 2 marks each), stores it in stable storage, and returns the test ID

Add role-based authorization to the createFullSyllabusTest endpoint so only authenticated admin users can create Full Syllabus Tests, using Internet Identity principal to verify admin status via the existing access control integration

Create a backend API endpoint getFullSyllabusTests in backend/main.mo that returns a list of all Full Syllabus Mock Tests with their IDs, names, section configurations, creation timestamps, and status

Create a backend API endpoint assignQuestionsToTest in backend/main.mo that accepts testId and arrays of questionIds for section1 (Physics and Chemistry questions) and section2 (Maths questions), validates that the questions exist and match the section subjects, associates the questions with the test, and returns success confirmation
Add admin role-based authorization to the assignQuestionsToTest endpoint so only authenticated admin users can assign questions to Full Syllabus Tests

Update the submitSection backend endpoint in backend/main.mo to handle chapterWise tests: accept sectionNumber = 0 for single-section tests, validate timing against the test's custom durationMinutes field, calculate score using the test's custom marksPerQuestion value, store answers in singleSectionAnswers, store score in singleSectionScore, and record singleSectionSubmittedAt timestamp
Update the getTestAttempt backend endpoint in backend/main.mo to return singleSectionStartTime, singleSectionSubmittedAt, and singleSectionScore fields when the test attempt is for a chapterWise test

Update TestInterface.tsx to detect test type from the test attempt data and handle chapterWise tests with a single section: display custom duration countdown timer (calculated from test's durationMinutes field), show all questions in one continuous section without section transitions, and auto-submit when timer reaches zero

Update ResultPage.tsx to handle both test types: for chapterWise tests, display single section score using singleSectionScore, calculate time taken from singleSectionStartTime to singleSectionSubmittedAt, show total questions attempted/correct/incorrect from singleSectionAnswers, and display all questions with answers and explanations in a single review section
